chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan R. Cruz Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Juan R. Cruz Jr. is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Juan R. Cruz Jr. was found guilty of Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence is consecutive to any other sentence but concurrent to Ct 4 in 14-CF-987.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay DNA surcharge (unless previously paid.  Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May Not have contact with Kimberly R or Sandra Z, Jasmine N unless otherwise permitted by the court.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Brett Ekes.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification and sentencing arguments are made.  Count 1 - Deft. is sentenced to 5 years in the WSP; 2 years Initial Confinement followed by 3 years Extended Supervision.  Sentence is consecutive to any other sentence but concurrent to Count 4 in 14CF987.  Credit for 192 days granted in this file only.  Deft. is eligible for CIP & SAP.  Restitution is stipulated to in the amount of $139.99 in 13CM428 (Read In) and State to draft the restitution order.   Cash Bond on deposit shall be applied and any remaining balance to be applied to the other files.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning and Voting Acknowledgement given.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Attorney Brett A Ekes appeared on behalf of the defendant who does not appear.  Clerk: PT
Parties state they recently learned DE was revoked and is now at Jackson Correctional so no writ was prepared for today.  Sentencing adj. to 3/4/15 at 11:00 AM and DA's Office to prepare a Writ.

Count 1 - Plea of guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Presentence investigation ordered.  Sentencing 11/25/14 at 2:30.  Bond continued.
